Name: Statue of Geb as a Mummy
Description: The gilded wooden statue portrays Geb, the god of earth and agriculture, standing on a small rectangular base. He is depicted in the form of a mummy, with his body completely enveloped in a cloak. His arms are crossed on his chest, which is adorned by a large pectoral. He wears a three-part wig on his head. His body is entirely gilded except for his eyes, eyebrows, and false beard.
